page.title: 08Crops at Upper Lutheredge.
page.content: The crops the farmer grows are wheat and barley.Wheat and barley have been grown on the same land for 25 years. In the Middle Ages they practised rotation of the crops which enriched the soil so the next year's yield was greater. At the bottom of the barley crop there is a diseased leaf. To prevent the disease spreading up, the crops are sprayed with modern fungicides. The top leaves work hard to use the sunlight to create starch. Nitrogen is put on the soil to make the crop a darker green with bigger leaves. It has to be given the correct amount of fertilizer to make it grow as well as possible.The yield has been increased from 1.25 tonnes to 3 tonnes per acre. The barley is planted in mid-September and harvested in mid-July so it has{10 months}to grow. The barley grows from October onwards.
